task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 293°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline and base clearly to estimate its total height, so I should tilt the view upward while staying on the same heading.
The view is now pointing north instead of the target northwest building, so I should rotate left to re-acquire the building while keeping the upward pitch to judge roof height.
I’m aligned with the target building again, so I should now provide an estimate using visible stories and typical floor-to-floor height.
